content.question: Cylinders of various masses are individually hung on a spring of spring constant <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> and set into simple harmonic motion. The angular frequency <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> is determined. Then, the square of <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> is plotted as a function of the inverse of the cylinder weight, as shown in the graph. Which of the following correctly determines the spring constant <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> and provides correct justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="k equals, 150 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>150</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>, because the slope of the best-fit line is equal to <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>.

<math alttext="k equals, 15 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>, because the slope of the best-fit line is equal to <math alttext="g times k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>g</mi><mo>×</mo><mi>k</mi></math>.

<math alttext="k equals, 6.7 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.7</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>, because the slope of the best fit line is equal to <math alttext="the fraction 1 over k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>k</mi></mfrac></math>.

<math alttext="k equals, 6.7 times 10 to the negative 2 power, newton per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo> </mo><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>, because the slope of the best fit line is equal to <math alttext="the fraction g over k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>g</mi><mi>k</mi></mfrac></math>.

<math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> cannot be determined from the graph, because <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> does not depend on <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="k equals, 15 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>, because the slope of the best-fit line is equal to <math alttext="g times k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>g</mi><mo>×</mo><mi>k</mi></math>.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
